javelin.model.unit

Class Monster

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.model.unit.Monster
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class Monster
extends java.lang.Object
implements Cloneable, java.io.Serializable
    A Monster represents a stat-block (monster information) from the monster manual. Different in-game battle units can be linked to the same stat block. A player character creates it's own stat-block which is updated as he levels up. For performance, Monsters are not to be cloned during BattleNode replication. A monster should only be cloned and modified during AI thinking in the case a spell or ability changes that specific unit's stats (cat's grace or level drain, for example).
    Author:
    Brian Voon Yee Yap, alex
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • walk

        public int walk
        5 units = 1 square. A unit is able to move this number of squares as a move-equivalent action (.5 action points).
        See Also:
        fly

      • fly

        public int fly
        Flying allows an unit to ignore water and obstacles. A flying unit should have walk 0. TODO also offer perfect flight, which could at least charge through obstacles.
        See Also:
        walk

      • burrow

        public int burrow
        Burrow allows a creature to submerge into the earth. Normally they would be able to descend to any depth but due to AI and complexity concerns burrowing right is more restrict. Read "combatmodifiers.txt". Burrowing and surfacing cost the equivalent of a single square movement unless engaged.

      • swim

        public int swim
        A swimming creature is able to ignore water penalties and charge through flooded squares.
        See Also:
        walk

        Use instead.

      • dr

        public int dr
        Damage reduction.

      • energyresistance

        public int energyresistance
        Energy resistance. Currently applied to everything that is not a physical attacks like melee, ranged and charge. A value of Integer.MAX_VALUE means energy immunity.

      • sr

        public int sr
        Spell resistance. "To affect a creature that has spell resistance, a spellcaster must make a caster level check (1d20 + caster level) at least equal to the creature’s spell resistance."

      • lawful

        public java.lang.Boolean lawful
        Alignment. true if lawful, null if neutral, false if chaotic.

      • good

        public java.lang.Boolean good
        Alignment. true if good, null if neutral, false if evil.

      • humanoid

        public boolean humanoid
        A monster is humanoid if it can use most of it's Slots to wear Artifacts. Humanoid and monstrous humanoid monster types are humanoid by default, other types have to manually marked as Humanoid="yes" in monster.xml to be marked as such. Ideally this would be defined in a slot-by-slot and monster-by-monster basis but for now a creature tagged as humanoid is eligible to use any and all Slots.

        public boolean immunitytomind
        Immune to mind-affecting effects.

      • poison

        public int poison
        Temporary constitution damage. 1 poison = -2 temporary constitution score.

      • skillpool

        public int skillpool
        Unspent skill points.

      • save

        public boolean save(int bonus,
                    int dc)
        Rolls a d20 to determine a saving throw result. Note that for being random this can only be used outside of BattleAi thinking.
        Parameters:
        bonus - fortitude(), will() or ref bonus. A value of Integer.MAX_VALUE represents automatic success.
        dc - Difficulty class target for the saving roll.
        Returns:
        true on save success.

      • perceive

        public int perceive(boolean flyingbonus)
        Vision penalties here cut in half because they apply only to vision, not listening.
        Parameters:
        skills - TODO
        flyingbonus - true if flying creatures get a bonus for seeing farther.
        Returns:
        Modified spot rank for given Monster.

      • think

        public boolean think(java.lang.Integer minimum)
        Parameters:
        minimum - Minimum intelligence bonus required. If null will assume -1 or higher is fine (primitive intelligence).
        Returns:
        true if able to communicate and think reasonably well. Being able to understand and follow simple, general tasks should do (which is not the case for animals that can only follow a few specific, well-trained tasks).

      • view

        public int view()
        Returns:
        a -0, -2 or -4 skill check penalty depending on time of day and Monster vision.
        See Also:
        Javelin.getDayPeriod(), vision

      • purchaseskills

        public SkillSelectionScreen purchaseskills(Upgrade u)
        Call this to spend skillpool.
        Parameters:
        u - If null will use all available classes to determine class skills.
        Returns:
        You can either call SkillSelectionScreen.show() for user input or SkillSelectionScreen.upgradeautomatically() for no user input.
        See Also:
        ClassAdvancement, RaiseIntelligence, skills

      • disarm

        public int disarm()
        Returns:
        Take-10 roll of Skills.disabledevice.
        See Also:
        Skills.take10(int, int)

      • getterrains

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getterrains()
        Returns:
        All terrain types this monster can be found in. May be empty if this is an internal Javelin monster (like Town Workers).
        See Also:
        Terrain.toString()
